intro: Geigeria alata, commonly known as the winged geigeria, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is distinguished by its slender, winged stems and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky or sandy soils. Geigeria alata is also valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
